Ukraine's fight against corruption remains fragile
subhead: In July, a law stripping two anti-corruption agencies of their independence sparked an outcry, forcing President Volodymyr Zelensky to backtrack. Two months later, while the agencies' autonomy was officially restored, their staff have criticized the government for a lack of support.

Trump makes U-turn on Ukraine and lectures Europeans at the UN
subhead: The US president made a dramatic reversal on his own position regarding the war in Ukraine on Tuesday, declaring that Kyiv 'is in a position to fight and win all of Ukraine back in its original form.' Speaking at the United Nations, he criticized European countries' migration and energy policies.

title: Syria's new president stresses diplomacy but warns against Israel in UN debut
subhead: On his first appearance at the UN General Assembly, Syria's new president Ahmed al-Sharaa warned that Israeli strikes threaten to destabilize the region, even as he pledged commitment to dialogue and a break from decades of Assad family rule.

title: Claudia Cardinale, the muse of Italian cinema, has died aged 87
subhead: Since her movie debut at the age of 14, she played roles of working-class and bourgeois women and bomb planters, without ever losing her modesty. She died at the age of 87 on Tuesday.

title: BYD Vice President Stella Li says Chinese automaker is in Europe for the 'long term'
subhead: The Chinese car group has demonstrated its ambitions at the Lyon Auto Show, which runs from September 24 to 28. Le Monde spoke with Stella Li, who jointly manages the company with her husband, Wang Chuanfu.

subhead: France's president formally recognized the State of Palestine on behalf of France on Monday, at the United Nations. Here is the full speech he made.

title: Italy's 'anti-vax' movement is galvanized by Kennedy Jr
subhead: Ever since Robert F. Kennedy Jr was appointed as US health secretary, the scientific community has feared that skepticism of vaccines could spread to the rest of the world. In Italy, his influence has already become apparent.

title: Dan Ben-David, economist: 'Israel has broken the roots of its growth'
subhead: The professor at Tel Aviv University warns that years of underinvestment, especially in education, and the rising influence of religious Jews are pushing Israel toward an existential crisis.
